EmailTemplate.subject: Only 1 week left to save $400 on your SpringOne Platform pass
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://2018.event.springoneplatform.io/register?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=s1p-price-cliff-speaker-highlights-q118]]> Where else can you connect with like-minded people and cloud experts from leading software companies, enterprises, and startups to collaborate, share knowledge, and create transformational software?
Join us September 24–27, 2018 in Washington, D.C., for SpringOne Platform 2018 <[[https://springoneplatform.io/?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=s1p-price-cliff-speaker-highlights-q118]]>, to hear from a lineup of luminaries behind leading open source projects and companies like:
- Chris Fussell. Chris is the author of "One Mission," the follow up to "Team of Teams" and a former Navy SEAL Officer.
- Bruno Borges. As a member of the Azure Cloud Developer Advocacy team at Microsoft, Bruno is on a mission to help MS engineers empower Java developers, using Microsoft technologies.
- Juergen Hoeller. The Spring Framework project lead will be back again to share all the exciting updates to the Spring family of projects.
- Neha Narkhede. Neha is the co-founder of Confluent and one of the initial authors of Apache Kafka. She’s an expert on modern, stream-based data processing.
And more! We continuously update the SpringOne Platform <[[https://springoneplatform.io/?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=s1p-price-cliff-speaker-highlights-q118]]> website with new speakers, workshops, and trainings, so be sure to check in on occasion.
Save $400 Off A Standard Conference Pass Early Bird registration and discounted training prices end on May 1, 2018 at 11:59 PM (Pacific Daylight Time). Register now <[[https://2018.event.springoneplatform.io/register?utm_source=pivotal-email&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=s1p-price-cliff-speaker-highlights-q118]]> and save $400 before it’s too late!
Stay connected Join the conversation on Twitter #SpringOne <[[https://twitter.com/hashtag/springone]]>, and follow @S1P <[[https://twitter.com/s1p?lang=en]]> for news and updates.
I hope to see you there,
Richard Seroter
